alert.note: Alert for Coastal Volusia; Inland Volusia (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 27 at 3:56PM EDT by NWS Melbourne
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Volusia County through 445 PM EDT... At 356 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles east of Lake Helen, moving southeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Deltona, Port Orange, New Smyrna Beach, Edgewater and Osteen. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or hard-topped vehicle. Remember, when thunder roars, go indoors!
